intro: Ononis pseudocephalantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Ononis pseudocephalantha is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
